snippet: Two settlement actions seemed timed to punish the Palestinians for securing upgraded status at the United Nations, and appeared to show that hard-liners had prevailed in the debate over a response.
abstract: Israel will move forward with development of Jewish settlements in contentious area east of Jerusalem, defying United States by advancing project that has long been condemned as effectively dooming any prospect of a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict; decision comes one day after United Nations General Assembly voted overwhelmingly to upgrade the status of Palestinians.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Mark Landler from Washington. Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington; Peter Baker from Hatfield, Pa.; and Ethan Bronner from New York.

lead_paragraph: Two settlement actions seemed timed to punish the Palestinians for securing upgraded status at the United Nations, and appeared to show that hard-liners had prevailed in the debate over a response.

headline.seo: Israel Moves to Expand Settlements in East Jerusalem
headline.main: Housing Move in Israel Seen as Setback for a Two-State Plan
headline.print_headline: Israel Advances Settlement Plan Near Jerusalem
